title: #Greatest
author: #Greatest
content: Considering the increasing interest from institutional investors, what impact do you think it will have on the overall value and perception of Bitcoin in 2024?I for one, personally think that Institutional investors have the potential to significantly impact the value and perception of Bitcoin in 2024. Their involvement brings more legitimacy and stability to the market, which can attract more investors and increase overall confidence in Bitcoin. As institutional adoption grows, it could potentially lead to a higher demand for Bitcoin, driving up its value. It's an exciting development that could shape the future of Bitcoin!What do you think?

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: People will have better access to bitcoin without needing to create a crypto exchange account(positive for price), but at the same time people will have better access to shorting bitcoin(negative for price). In the end, it pretty much means that it could make bitcoin more efficient price-wise; but it definitely doesn't mean that it'll stop being volatile — because it will very very likely still be.

Their involvement brings more legitimacy and stability to the market, which can attract more investors and increase overall confidence in Bitcoin. As institutional adoption grows, it could potentially lead to a higher demand for Bitcoin, driving up its value.The institutional investors have been there IIRC since 2021 and backward, so it's not new that they're going to indulge on this market because they already did. And with the success and approval of the bitcoin spot etf, that already signifies that this is becoming and serious market and investment. From there, that's already going to attract more investors through the ETF but then, IMO they are going to learn on how to invest directly to Bitcoin and will learn about holding private keys and using noncustodial wallets.Quote from: #Greatest on January 21, 2024, 03:31:15 PMIt's an exciting development that could shape the future of Bitcoin!What do you think?Exciting indeed and that's why the most patient investors and holders are the ones that's going to benefit from this development that we're having for Bitcoin. Because if you are the impatient investor and you want to just watch out where it is coming before buying in, you might miss the bull run if you don't hold that much. I've got friends that are starting to approach me and ask about what to do, I've just said the same thing to buy now and hold. It's simple as that.

comments.author: nil_krokodil
comments.body: Bitcoin in 2024 will be bullish and probably continue where it left last year. For new investments, Bitcoin will be eligible because Gary Gensler just created a new market for Bitcoin. Bitcoin can now get bought directly from Wall Street. Overally we have much many positive news for Bitcoin and bulls can have an extended run. To be safe, we need to make sure as well: Call a hunter when you see a bear!

The market was heated up when there was a potential to approve Bitcoin ETF. But that afford trend is nowhere to be seen now even after it is approved. That's quite surprising! Probably something is going in the back end which we are not able to understand. I personally didn't like companies like blackrock entering into Bitcoin market. comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: Quote from: #Greatest on January 21, 2024, 03:31:15 PMTheir involvement brings more legitimacy and stability to the market, which can attract more investors and increase overall confidence in Bitcoin. As institutional adoption grows, it could potentially lead to a higher demand for Bitcoin, driving up its value. It's an exciting development that could shape the future of Bitcoin!You don't need institutional investors to understand that BTC is a legitimate network, it is open source and you can verify everything yourself. The BTC network doesn't need institutional investors, as a matter of fact what they bring to the network is sometimes against the principles of BTC; i.e. BTC etf's provides a way for people to buy BTC without owning their keys and that is not a recommended way to buy BTC, because not your keys, not your coins.However, institutional investors can influence the price of BTC positively, they pump money into BTC and that can make the price to pump, but that does not mean that they are a must for the network to grow.

Do you also know that the so called governments who are fighting against bitcoin also have their holdings hence are trying everything humanly possible to have every control over  bitcoin just for their self interest and personal gain to protect their investment not to be tempered., What i could speculates more is max adoption this year and the usability.

With the recent Btc ETF approval, I guess more institutions are probably eager to jump in any moment.In my opinion, I would say 2024 has a lot more to offer in terms of crypto in general and we are just getting stated.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: Opinion is still positive for a long time, but for a short time we may not see significant improvements. We have seen ETFs encouraging institutional investors. But it's not positive until they directly invest in Bitcoin instead of ETFs. This year will be Bitcoin halving, where we may see a short pump. But it won't last long. To me, next year, 2025, will be a bitcoin bull run. It's just my opinion; I don't analyse anything. So asking for reasons won't get a proper answer. But the fact is, it takes time to start bull after halving, not instantly.

But the fact is, it takes time to start bull after halving, not instantly.If there is anytime that I have feared bitcoin and other volatile market more, it should be this time around. Obviously no one believed that after the Bitcoin ETF approval and they arrival of the institutional traders into the cryptocurrency, that the price of Bitcoin will rather deep instead of bull. If anyone or any prophet told me that it will happen this, I would not just believe. But now it has happened, I am very well convinced that nothing is assured in the cryptocurrency market. I am confidently telling you that even the upcoming bull run might fail and nothing will happen. Just follow the archaic  but standard rule for investment in volatile assets, invest what you can afford to lose and have peace of mind. If you neglect this very rule, you might end up having a heart attack and you can possibly lose all your assets.I am wiser now and I can say the wiser I become in the cryptocurrency industry the more fearful I become. This is the reason why I have always sticked with Bitcoin. I am no longer comfortable with any coin and I have never been comfortable with any other coin apart from Bitcoin. Just a little advice I took from a friend and bought solana, I am currently at 35% loss within few weeks and I have never been at rest till now. If this was bitcoin, I will be confident that someday this coin will reverse as we all know but currently I don't know my faith.

The ETF news was previously cashed, now we need real capital flow in the market to shoot up again and more likely by the middle of 2024 we can have discussions again about what is next.
